content: First to start off i am 22 years old and i have been trying to get in the USMC for the past 4 years now. i have encountered numerous problems trying to get in losing over 110lbs to make it to required weight getting my GED and going to college to be considered i HS Grad. i have done all of this to make to where i am today but earlier this month out of my 22 years on this earth i managed to get in trouble for the first time in my life by getting a DUI and fleeing and evading on my motorcycle. i was to supposed to ship out near the end of April. and i cant believe i ****ed up the way i did fortunately the judge dropped the felony charge of fleeing to a misdemeanor. it was either serve 20 days in jail or serve 2 years probation i took the 20 in jail because I'm well aware that you cant join up while on probation. all of my fines are already paid thanks to my awesome supportive family which i cant express my thankfulness enough to them. what other problems am i going to encounter after i get out jail will they still let me leave to bct? i get out on the 7th of April by the way I'm just so scared i wont get to go after waiting and working so hard to do this can someone please help?! :-(

content: OK, first of all, you need to contact your recruiter and tell him. If he's honest, he can work this out. If he tells you not to mention anyting about it, that's a red flag. It WILL bite you in the azz later, esp if you need a secuirty clearance. You can also post your question here Joining the military Off the top of my head, IF you've served your time and paid your fines, you SHOULD be OK. BUTTTTT because it was a DUI, I don't know for sure. Good Luck, sounds like you worked hard for it. BUT for the love of God, Let this be a lesson, you stand to LOOSE alot on one boneheaded moment. The stakes are ALOT higher when your fellow Marines count on you to coner thier azzws!
